topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.1: Prerequisites - Download the Installation Packages Conref

titlealts.searchtitle: HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade Installation Prerequisites

body.p: This document is a repository for the download information to be shared among the deployment instructions:
This document describes the prerequisite steps to download the installation files required to install HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade.
body.section:
In a browser, navigate to Helion Download Network(HDN).
Click Sign In to log in using your account.
After signing in, click the Downloads link in the menu on the left side of the page.
Click the Downloads tab and locate the following download.
Helion Carrier Grade 2.0 DCN Part 1 of 1 Installation files for the HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade Tahoe, Memphis, and Sacramento deployments. This link will download the hcg2_kvm_esx_ironic_vrs.tar.gz file.
Helion Carrier Grade 2.0 DCN Part 1 of 1 Checksum. The SHA256 checksum for HPE Helion Carrier Grade 2.0 VRS. This link will download the hcg2_kvm_esx_ironic_vrs.tar.gz.sha256 file.
Helion Carrier Grade 2.0 DCN Part 1 of 1 Signature. The signature file for HPE Helion Carrier Grade 2.0 VRS. This link will download the hcg2_kvm_esx_ironic_vrs.tar.gz.sig file.
GPG Keys to Verify Signature Files The public keys for HPE Helion Carrier Grade 2.0.
Click the Downloads tab and locate the following download.
Helion Carrier Grade 2.0.0 AVS Installation files for the HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade Tahoe, Memphis, and Sacramento deployments. This link will download the hcg2_kvm_avs.tar.gz file.
Helion Carrier Grade 2.0 AVS Checksum. The SHA256 checksum for HPE Helion Carrier Grade 2.0 VRS. This link will download the hcg2_kvm_avs.tar.gz.sha256 file.
Helion Carrier Grade 2.0 AVS Signature. The signature file for HPE Helion Carrier Grade 2.0 VRS. This link will download the hcg2_kvm_avs.tar.gz.sig file.
GPG Keys to Verify Signature Files The public keys for HPE Helion Carrier Grade 2.0.
Optionally, download the Helion Carrier Grade 2.0 Infoblox Plugin. Also, download the checksum and signature files.
Download the following mandatory patches:
Helion Carrier Grade 2.0 Horizon001 Patch002. This link will download the HCG2.0_Horizon001_Patch002.tar.gz file.
Helion Carrier Grade 2.0 Heat001 Patch003. This link will download the HCG2.0_Heat001_Patch003.tar.gz file.
Helion Carrier Grade 2.0 DCN001 Patch004. This link will downoad the Helion Carrier Grade 2.0 DCN001 Patch004 file.
Helion Carrier Grade 2.0 WR002 Patch005.This link will download the HCG2.0_WR002_Patch005.tar.gz file.
Note: When downloading installation files, always download and verify the signature file before installing.

section.title: Download the HPE Linux Source
section.p: The lifecycle manager host must have HPE Linux installed before performing the HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade installation. Download the source files for installing HPE Linux on the Non-KVM Region systems.

ol.li: In a browser, navigate to Helion Download Network(HDN).
Click Sign In to log in using your account.
After signing in, click the Downloads link in the menu on the left side of the page.
Click the Downloads tab and locate the following download: Helion Carrier Grade 2.1 AVS. This link downloads the hcg21_kvm_avs.tar.gz file. Also download the associated checksum and signature files.
Extrct the hcg21_kvm_avs.tar.gz file. The compressed file contains the hcg21_kvm_avs.tar file.
Extract the hcg21_kvm_avs.tar file. The compressed file contains the hcg21_kvm_avs directory.

Change to the the hcg21_kvm_avs directory. The HPE Linux installation file is called hpelinux-hcg-kvm-amd64-20160224.iso.iso. This ISO contains all required files to install HPE Linux and all Linux packages required for HPE Helion Carrier Grade.

Use the following commands to mount the ISO file . mkdir <local_file> mount -oro ~cghelion/hpelinux-hcg-kvm-amd64-20160224.iso.iso <local_file> Where: <local file> is the path to the file where you mounted the ISO. For example:mkdir /mnt/local_repo mount -oro ~cghelion/hpelinux-hcg-kvm-amd64-20160224.iso.iso /mnt/local_repo/

Execute the following command to copy all of the files off the ISO file to the local file system:cd /mnt tar cf - <local_repo> | ( cd /opt/; tar xf - )Where: <local file> is the path to the file where you mounted the ISO. For example:cd /mnt tar cf - local_repo | ( cd /opt/; tar xf - )
The example command copies the the local_repo file from /mnt/local_repo to /opt/local_repo.
After the files are copied off the ISO, you can unmout the ISO.umount /mnt/<local_file>Where: <local file> is the path to the file where you mounted the ISO. For example: umount /mnt/local_repo

Modify the /etc/apt/sources.list file to make this local file repo available to the apt-get command by commenting out the deb-src cdrom and deb cdrom lines and adding the following:deb [trusted=yes] file:<local file> cattleprod contrib main non-free
Where: <local file> is the path to the file where you copied the contents of the ISO. For example:#deb-src cdrom:[hLinux _cattleprod_ - Official amd64 blaster NETINST 20151009-hlm%]/ cattleprod contrib main non-free #deb cdrom:[hLinux _cattleprod_ - Official amd64 blaster NETINST 20151009-hlm%]/ cattleprod contrib main non-free deb [trusted=yes] file:/opt/local_repo/ cattleprod contrib main non-free
Execute the following command to update the apt package index files:apt-get update

Download the following mandatory patches:
Helion Carrier Grade 2.0 Horizon001 Patch002. This link will download the HCG2.0_Horizon001_Patch002.tar.gz file.
Helion Carrier Grade 2.0 Heat001 Patch003. This link will download the HCG2.0_Heat001_Patch003.tar.gz file.
Helion Carrier Grade 2.0 WR002 Patch005.This link will download the HCG2.0_WR002_Patch005.tar.gz file.

section.p: Note: When downloading installation files, always download and verify the signature file before installing.

section.title: Download the installation files

In a browser, navigate to Helion Download Network(HDN).

After signing in, click the Downloads link in the menu on the left side of the page.
Click the Downloads tab and locate the following download:
Helion OpenStack 2.1. This link downloads the HelionOpenStack-2.1.iso file. Also download the associated checksum and signature files.

HCG2.0_WR002_Patch005

You will install these patches during the installation of the KVM Region.

section.title: Verify the downloaded signature
section.p: After downloading the installation packages, you should verify the signature of the download. You can use the GPG utility, which is already installed on the lifecycle manager host. Signed by the signature file.

A set of GPG public keys are available on Helion Download Network(HDN) . If you did not download the public keys in the previous section, click the GPG Keys to Verify Signature Files link in HDN to download the GPG-HPCSS-Public-Keys.tar file.

ol.li: Copy the GPG-HPCSS-Public-Keys.tar file to the /root/cg/ directory. You will need to create this directory:mkdir /root/cg/
Extract the file. tar xvf GPG-HPCSS-Public-Keys.tar

Copy the public keys to the lifecycle manager host, extract the keys from the compressed files.
The following keys are included in the download:
Hewlett Packard EnterpriseCompanyRSA(HPCodesigningService)-1.pub
Hewlett Packard EnterpriseCompanyRSA(HPCodesigningService)-2.pub
Hewlett Packard EnterpriseCompanyRSA(HPCodesigningService)-3.pub
Hewlett Packard EnterpriseCompanyRSA(HPCodesigningService)-4.pub
Hewlett Packard EnterpriseCompanyRSA(HPCodesigningService)-5.pub
hpPublicKey.pub
hpPublicKey2048.pub

Execute the following command to import the keys: gpg --import "<filename>"
Where <filename> is the name of the extracted file.
The keys are then imported into the gpgp key share: gpg --import hpPublicKey.pub gpg --import Hewlett-PackardCompanyRSA(HPCodesigningService)-1.pub gpg --import Hewlett-PackardCompanyRSA(HPCodesigningService)-2.pub gpg --import Hewlett-PackardCompanyRSA(HPCodesigningService)-3.pub gpg --import Hewlett-PackardCompanyRSA(HPCodesigningService)-4.pub gpg --import Hewlett-PackardCompanyRSA(HPCodesigningService)-5.pub gpg --import hpPublicKey2048.pub

Use the following command to view the keys in the key store: gpg --list-keys
The key store appears similar to the following:/home/sad/.gnupg/pubring.gpg -\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\- pub 2048R/B1275EA3 2014-11-19 [expires: 2024-11-16] uid [ unknown] Hewlett-Packard Company RSA (HP Codesigning Service) - 1 pub 2048R/B564A643 2014-11-19 [expires: 2024-11-16] uid [ unknown] Hewlett-Packard Company RSA (HP Codesigning Service) - 2 pub 2048R/FF94BC78 2014-11-19 [expires: 2024-11-16] uid [ unknown] Hewlett-Packard Company RSA (HP Codesigning Service) - 3 pub 2048R/BA849975 2014-11-19 [expires: 2024-11-16] uid [ unknown] Hewlett-Packard Company RSA (HP Codesigning Service) - 4 pub 2048R/C6978F0C 2014-11-19 [expires: 2024-11-16] uid [ unknown] Hewlett-Packard Company RSA (HP Codesigning Service) - 5 pub 1024D/2689B887 2005-03-11 [expired: 2015-03-09] uid [ expired] Hewlett-Packard Company (HP Codesigning Service) pub 2048R/5CE2D476 2012-12-04 [expires: 2022-12-02] uid [ unknown] Hewlett-Packard Company RSA (HP Codesigning Service)

Use the following command to verify the signature: gpg --verify <path-to-file>/hcg21_kvm_avs.tar.gz.sig <path-to-file>/hcg21_kvm_avs.tar.gz
The output for the command appears similar to the following. This indicates the signature is verified: Good signature from "Hewlett Packard Enterprise Company RSA (HPE Codesigning Service).gpg: Signature made 03/01/16 13:50:21 Eastern Standard Time using RSA key ID C69 78F0C gpg: Good signature from "Hewlett-Packard Company RSA (HP Codesigning Service) - 5" [unknown] gpg: WARNING: This key is not certified with a trusted signature! gpg: There is no indication that the signature belongs to the owner. Primary key fingerprint: 2545 62E5 28F9 FE92 B85D 8200 FDF9 4EBB C697 8F0C
Perform this verification for each file you downloaded.

section.title: Verify the downloaded checksums
section.p: You should also use a checksum verification tool, such as sha256sum, which should come installed with Ubuntu.

ol.li:
Run the checksum tool against the download package: sha256sum <path-to-file>/hcg21_kvm_avs.tar.gz
The command can take a few minutes as the download package is a large file.

Compare the output of the checksum tool to the download checksum file. sha256sum hcg21_kvm_avs.tar.gz 4e5a5514ba87401750f01196c592d8d93a9eb6c06546 *hcg21_kvm_avs.tar.gzThe checksum file contains the date that the file was generated, the checksum string, and the name of the file that was used, similar to the following:Tue Mar 1 10:51:11 PST 2016 4e5a5514ba87401750f01196c592d8d93a9eb6c06546 hcg21_kvm_avs.tar.gz
